byline: Amy Dixon, Axel Lopez, MacKenzie Coffman & Liz Ketcham
Mavis Zeng, Angel Liang, Alice Lin
Hanna Rashidi, Claire Sun, Angela Song, Courtney Fortier, Anh-vy Pham and Jae Su
Alexandra Del Rosario & Juliette Le Saint
imagecredits: Amy Dixon, Michael Zshornack and Jenna Nicole Smith
Mavis Zeng, Angel Liang, Alice Lin
imagedescription: A picture of Graduate Students Association President Michael Skiles looking serious with Westwood in the background.
An illustration of a student looking at another student's work
A graphic of Campus Safety Task Force reforms
A graphic of timeline of the Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals program
A photo of Lt. Col. Shannon Stambersky, the UCLA Army ROTC head, in uniform
A photo of distinguished psychology professor David Sears sitting in his office
A group photo of Near Eastern languages and cultures professor Robert Englund and a large group of people at an excavation site
Photos of each of the six protests
A picture of Sylvie Vaught, a graduate student in cinema and media studies, and her daughter, second-year music student Chloe Vaught, with a school mascot
A picture of Kelli Hayes laying down in her graduation outfit holding a basketball
A picture of graduating UCLA beach volleyball player Elise Zappia standing in the beach volleyball locker room with her uniform on
A game shot of graduating UCLA men's basketball center Thomas Welsh with his right fist up in the air
A picture of graduating UCLA gymnastics member Peng-Peng Lee at a meet with her arms up in the air while smiling
A game shot of Jake Bird throwing a pitch

A courtesy photo of beach volleyball players rising senior Sarah Sponcil, who is part of the UCLA team, and Lauren Fendrick, a UCLA alumna, hitting the ball back to the other team while one of them is jumping
Illustration of UCLA men's basketball guard Jaylen Hands with a bag of Scooby Snacks
A picture of Josh Rosen handing the ball off to rising senior running back Bolu Olorunfunmi
The graphic titled "The Class of 2018 Legacy"
Graphic titled "Which Were the Best Teams on Campus This Year"
Illustration of a grid of power lines overlain across a terrain
Illustration of Bruin Bear carressing a child, signifying UCLA's support (or what should be UCLA's support) for student and faculty parents on campus.

Editorial cartoon depicting UCLA chancellor Gene Block walking off a stage after giving the graduation commencement speech, stating "1 down, 3 more to go" as a reference to the other speakers backing out.

Editorial cartoon depicting Westwood as a desolate, barren ghost town following the end of the academic year, stating "Over the summer months, Westwood business owners become uncomfortably aware of their dependance on the student population."
A photo of UCLA's Collaborative Game Design club members sitting in a classroom.
A photo of fourth-year English and premedical student Derek Nguyen smiling and using his hands to compose a frame.

A photo of Taj Shaikh in sunglasses and a UCLA graduation stole, smoking a cigarette. The photographer encourages her UCLA clients to bring objects such as fidget spinners or beer cans to their graduation shoots to create edgier, more eccentric photos.
A photo of fourth-year art student Luke Jaffar posing with items from Greenbacks, his original clothing line which aims to criticize the role of money in captialist America.
A photo of fourth-year cognitive science student Maddie Gavin performing her set at Westwoodstock under her DJ name "Officer Gavin."

A photo of Jumo Yang, a third-year design media arts student who is co-creating video game using photogrammetry, a technique that consists of creating physical objects and scanning them into a 3D format on a computer.
A photo of the Freud Playhouse, where Reprise 2.0's "Sweet Charity" will be staged starting June 20.
The left photo shows a young Justin Yang smiling at the camera, while the right pictures shows Yang recreating the same smile 11 years later
After rising sophomore guard Kris Wilkes dunks a ball, he flexes and shouts towards the spectators in Pauley Pavilion.
Molecular, cell and developmental biology students fourth-year Fernando De La Torre and third-year Emma Edmond inspect glass vials in a lab.
A photo of Jinjie Chen on her computer
A photo of five graduating seniors spraying champagne while shirtless in the fountain outside Royce Hall
A photo of William Wharton using a VR headset
A photo of the men's club rowing team in their boat

A graphic with a line graph spanning from 1999 to 2017, depicting which field each key note speaker from that year is accomplished in-- categorized into STEM, Politics/Law, Arts, Entertainment/Sports, Business and Literature/Education. The graph also depicts the number of degrees were awarded that year, which steadily rises. Below the graph is six spotlights of the speakers with a illustrated bust of each. Those spotlighted are Oscar Arias Sanchez, Kareem Abdul-Jabbar, Randy Schekman, Frank Marshall, Jessica Jackley, and Nathan Myhrvold.
An illustration depicting a UCLA student reflecting on their college years by holding up polaroid photographs of their graduation.
A graphic of the biggest stories from the 2017–2018 school year.
A timeline graphic explaining UCLA's history with the quarter system.
An illustration of young people hanging out in Westwood.
An photograph of graduating Middle Eastern studies student Robyn Kim.
An illustration of a small young bear wearing a graduation sash.

A photo of the Daily Bruin's 2017-2018 managing editor Madeleine Pauker

The graph also depicts the number of degrees were awarded that year, which steadily rises. Below the graph is six spotlights of the speakers with a illustrated bust of each. Those spotlighted are Oscar Arias Sanchez, Kareem Abdul-Jabbar, Randy Schekman, Frank Marshall, Jessica Jackley, and Nathan Myhrvold.
